intro: Louvelia albicans, commonly known as the white lily of the Nile, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its striking white, trumpet-shaped flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant is often found growing near water sources, indicating its preference for moist, well-drained soils. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its resilience in tropical and subtropical climates. The botanical features of Louvelia albicans make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
